intro: Stenorrhynchos canterae, commonly known as the Canterbury lily, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves and showy, purple or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. It is notable for its ability to thrive in cool, temperate climates. Stenorrhynchos canterae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological importance in native habitats.
